Package fr.cnrs.iees.io.parsing.impl

Class GraphTokenizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.cnrs.iees.io.parsing.LineTokenizer
      • fr.cnrs.iees.io.parsing.impl.GraphTokenizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Tokenizer
    public class GraphTokenizer
extends LineTokenizer

    A crude tokenizer for graphs.

    It assumes the following text file syntax to describe graphs(GOMUGI data format in GraphFileFormats):

     graph = headline {line}
 headline = "graph" [comment] NEWLINE
 comment = "// [TEXT]"
 line = [{property|node|edge}] [comment] NEWLINE
 node = node_label [node_name]
 node_label = WORD
 node_name = TEXT
 property = prop_name "=" prop_type "(" prop_value ")"
 prop_name = TEXT 
 prop_type = JAVACLASS
 prop_value = LOADABLETEXT
 edge = "[" node_id "]" edge_label edge_name "[" node_id "]" 
 edge_label = WORD
 edge_name = TEXT
 node_id = node_label ":" node_name

    where:

    • NEWLINE = the end-of-line character
    • TEXT = any text (including white space)
    • WORD = any text with no white space
    • JAVACLASS = any java class that has a static valueOf(...) method
    • LOADABLETEXT = any text compatible with the matching valueOf(...) method to instantiate the class

    Properties are attached to the item (graph, node or edge) after which they appear.

    The label:name pair is assumed to uniquely represent a node or edge in the graph. Depending on implementation, they might represent a class name and instance unique id, or a real label and name.

    Little example of a valid graph text file:

    =====================
graph // this is a comment

//this is another comment

label1 name1
  prop1=Integer(1)
        prop2 =Double(2.0)
prop3= String("blabla")
                prop4 = Boolean(true)

label2 name2
label1 name3

[label1:name1] label4 name1 [label2:name2]
        [ label1:name1] label4 name2     [label2:name2 ]
[ label2:name2 ] label4 name1   [label1:name3]
label2 name5
prop1 = Integer(0)
=====================

    Notice that white space (blanks, tabs) and empty lines are ignored.

    Author:
    Jacques Gignoux - 7 d√©c. 2018
